Material used.Description: Cells were incubated with LRRK2 variants in the presence of ATP

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Reduced ATP binding affinity (wild-type: 2-fold lower ATP K_d)
Readout description.Result Description: At 1 mM ATP, wild-type LRRK2 had higher ATP binding affinity compared to I2020T variant.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Reduced ATP binding affinity (wild-type: 6-fold higher ATP K_d)
Readout description.Result Description: At 1 mM ATP, wild-type LRRK2 had lower ATP binding activity compared to G2019S variant.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed with each variant

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was tested in triplicate for consistent results

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 cDNA was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Beta-actin cDNA was used as a negative control.

Experiment Method.Statistical analysis method: Paired two-sample t-test was used to compare ATP binding activity between wild-type and mutant LRRK2 variants.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: ATP binding activity ≥90% of wild-type level at 1 mM.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: ATP binding activity ≤80% of wild-type level at 1 mM.

Approved assay.Approved assay: Yes, this experimental protocol is generally applicable to the study of Parkinson's Disease.
